title: nature
description: 1. all the animals, plants, rocks, etc. in the world and all the features...
cleaned_text: nature nounuk nature noun (LIFE) A2 [[ U ]](/es/help/codes.html) [lived](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/live)in [close](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/close) [communion](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/communion)with nature. - But I [digress](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/digress). To get back to what I was saying, this [poem](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/poem) [reflects](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/reflect)the poet's [love](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/love)of nature and U ]](/es/help/codes.html) the [type](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/type)or [main](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/main) [characteristic](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/characteristic)of something: be in the nature of things There are [problems](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/problem)in every [relationship](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/relationship)- it's in the nature of things. - Even the [police](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/police)were [horrified](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/horrified)at the [macabre](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/macabre)nature of the [killings](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/killing). encontrarás palabras, frases y sinónimos relacionados con los temas: nature noun (CHARACTER) B2 [[ C or person's [character](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/character): [[ + to infinitive ]](/es/help/codes.html)It's not really in nature to be [aggressive](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/aggressive). - I [think](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/think)she [takes](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/take) [advantage](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/advantage)of his good [vicar](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/vicar) [praised](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/praise)what [forbearing](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/es/diccionario/ingles/forbearing)nature". -
